meanings.definition: A substance that removes or neutralizes polarization.
meanings.sent1: The depolarizer helped balance the charges in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use a depolarizer to even out the electrical properties of the solution.
meanings.sent3: The depolarizer walked into the room and made everyone get along.
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted as a depolarizer, bringing harmony to the tense situation.
meanings.sent5: The depolarizer was like a peacekeeper, restoring order to the chaotic system.

meanings.definition: A device that eliminates differences in electrical charge.
meanings.sent1: The depolarizer machine equalized the charges in the circuit.
meanings.sent2: An electronic depolarizer can help stabilize the power supply.
meanings.sent3: The depolarizer device buzzed happily as it balanced the charges.
meanings.sent4: The depolarizer hummed like a symphony conductor, orchestrating the flow of electricity.
meanings.sent5: With a flick of a switch, the depolarizer transformed the chaotic energy into a steady stream.

meanings.definition: A chemical compound that reduces the polarization of light.
meanings.sent1: The depolarizer solution clarified the light passing through.
meanings.sent2: Photographers often use a depolarizer to enhance the quality of their images.
meanings.sent3: The depolarizer compound sparkled like a diamond under the light.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a depolarizer, cutting through the confusion like a beam of light.
meanings.sent5: The depolarizer seemed to magically erase the glare, revealing the true colors of the scene.
